key_points: Tiger Woods is recovering after a rollover car accident earlier this week.
He was transferred from Harbor-UCLA Medical Center to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles.
Woods received successful follow-up procedures on his injuries.
The family expressed gratitude for the support and messages received.
The accident occurred in Rancho Palos Verdes, California, causing major damage to Woods' car.
First responders had to extricate Woods from the vehicle.
He underwent emergency surgery for significant orthopedic injuries to his right lower extremity.
Injuries were stabilized with a rod, screws, and pins according to Dr. Anish Mahajan.
A source mentioned Woods has a long recovery ahead but is optimistic about his resilience.
Woods will have to make decisions regarding his career as he recovers.
spokespersons: Dr. Anish Mahajan (Chief Medical Officer, Harbor-UCLA Medical Center)
Carlos Gonzalez (Sheriff's Deputy, Los Angeles County)
